spoken-english-week8_key1:
Hello!!
This is your Class 8 for Spoken English course module.
spoken-english-week8_key5: If you could be any animal what would you be?
spoken-english-week8_key7: How do you think you would look if you were this animal?
spoken-english-week8_key8: What would you do if you were this animal?
spoken-english-week8_key10:
Volunteers may explain to the students the main parts of speech
( Noun, verb and Adjective).
Noun: A noun is a person, place, thing, quality, or act.
Examples: pencil, girl, shop, happiness
Verb: Verbs are action or existence words that tell what nouns do.
Examples: to fly, to run, to be, jump, lived
Adjective: An adjective describes a noun.
Examples: hairy, crazy, wonderful.
spoken-english-week8_key11: Choose the right Part of speech in the below sentence.
spoken-english-week8_key12: She wrote a letter to her grandmother. ( verb)
spoken-english-week8_key14: My Cat had a litter of Kittens(noun)
spoken-english-week8_key17: Arrange the jumbled words into a sentence. Please dictate the words in jumbled order for the student to write it down and they can then form it into a sentence. Volunteers can hint and give suggestions depending on the students fluency.
spoken-english-week8_key18: can you blue the ride bike?( Can you ride the blue bike?)
spoken-english-week8_key19: I am to school going ( I am going to school)
spoken-english-week8_key20:
landed her beautiful the butterfly on nose. (The beautiful
butterfly landed on her nose.)
spoken-english-week8_key21:
laugh crazy makes brother little me. (My crazy little brother
makes me laugh.)
spoken-english-week8_key22: book librarian gave me the a ( The librarian gave me a book.)
spoken-english-week8_key24: Arrange (verb) Meaning: (1) (when put in plan) to plan, prepare for, or organize something.
spoken-english-week8_key25:
Usage: The school will arrange transportation for the students.
Meaning:(2)(when put in position ) to put a group of objects in a
particular order:
Usage: His books are neatly arranged in alphabetical order.
spoken-english-week8_key27:
Pair and Share:
Topic : If you could be any animal what would you be and why?
spoken-english-week8_key29:
Main parts of speech : ( Noun, verb, adjective, adverb and pronoun).
Noun: A noun is a person, place, thing, quality, or act.
Examples: pencil, girl, shop, happiness
Verb: Verbs are action or existence words that tell what nouns do.
Examples: to fly, to run, to be, jump, lived
Adjective: An adjective describes a noun.
Examples: hairy, crazy, wonderful
Adverb: An adverb describes a verb, adjective, or adverb. It often
ends in "ly".
Examples: carefully, easily, barely
Pronoun: A pronoun replaces a noun or noun phrase that is
understood from context.
Examples: he, it, they
spoken-english-week8_key30: Choose the right Part of Speech in the below sentence.
spoken-english-week8_key34:
Freddie and Alex diligently saved their money to buy a new
chemistry set.(adjective)
spoken-english-week8_key35: He happily announced the cake was for me.(noun)
spoken-english-week8_key36: Adam carefully carried the sick puppy in his arms.(adverb)
spoken-english-week8_key37: What's mine is yours, my friend.(pronoun)

spoken-english-week8_key47:
Meaning: (1) to control something, especially by making it work in a particular way
Usage: The switch is used to regulate the speed at which the machine operates.
spoken-english-week8_key48:
Meaning:(2) to control an activity or process by rules or a system
Usage:Their parents regulate how much TV the children can watch.
spoken-english-week8_key49:
Regulation (noun)
Usage: We need to follow the regulation setup by the Health ministry to combat this virus.
